summary: Anne Paul Wilander was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents primarily consist of payroll records and certifications spanning from 1977 to 1979, detailing her position, salary, and pay period earnings. These records include payroll authorization forms, memoranda, and certification reports. The documents indicate her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. A Final Determination Notification from the Assassination Records Review Board mentions the postponement in part of a HSCA staff payroll record, specifically to redact Social Security numbers, and includes payroll authorization forms and related memoranda for Anne Paul Wilander.
significance: Anne Paul Wilander's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, her presence on the payroll indicates her involvement in the HSCA's operations during its investigation. The documents provide a glimpse into the administrative aspects of the HSCA's work.
